definitions: the quality of having great weight

examples.text: Olivia felt the heaviness of her backpack

definitions: a feeling of being weighed down, especially by weariness

examples.text: a persistent feeling of lethargy and heaviness

shortDefinitions: feeling of being weighed down by weariness

definitions: lack of delicacy or grace; coarseness
the quality of food being hard to digest

examples.text: the cloying heaviness of snacking on cheese

shortDefinitions: quality of food being hard to digest

definitions: a state of being greater in amount, force, or intensity than usual

examples.text: the heaviness of the rains in the valley caused flooding
the heaviness of their earlier defeat

shortDefinitions: state of being greater in amount, force, or intensity than usual

definitions: the quality of being oppressive or overpowering to the senses

examples.text: the heaviness of a hop aroma
the heaviness of the dark wood paneling

shortDefinitions: quality of being oppressive or overpowering to senses

definitions: (in relation to rock music) the quality of having a strong bass component and a forceful rhythm

examples.text: the total heaviness of much of this record

shortDefinitions: quality of having strong bass component and forceful rhythm

definitions: the quality of being very important or serious

examples.text: a few cartoon gags were introduced into the film to lighten its heaviness

shortDefinitions: quality of being very important or serious

definitions: a mentally oppressive feeling, especially of sadness or grief

examples.text: he felt the heaviness of loss as he watched her go
